com.example.PurSalAutoServer.Resources

Class CompanyResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.PurSalAutoServer.Resources.CompanyResource

  • @Path(value="company")
public class CompanyResource
extends java.lang.Object

    This is used for adding,editing and retriving company details for an particular user
    The base path is api/company/....
    The sample json object for the company details operation is
    {
    "companyaddress": "sample",
    "companymailid": "sample",
    "companyname": "sample",
    "companyphno": "56789",
    "id": 0
    }

    Author:
    gokul

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response editcompanyfromauth(java.lang.String uid, com.example.PurSalAutoServer.Entities.Company c)
      used to edit the existing company details
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getcompanyfromauth(java.lang.String uid)
      used to get the company details for an user for ascessing the operation use api/company/getcompany path for adding company details use the path company/putcompany
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response putcompanyfromauth(java.lang.String uid, com.example.PurSalAutoServer.Entities.Company c)
      used to add the company details for an user for ascessing the operation use api/company/putcompany path can be used to add only for first time for editing an existing details use the path company/editcompany

        @GET
 @Path(value="getcompany")
 @Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getcompanyfromauth(@HeaderParam(value="uid")
                                                                                                                                                java.lang.String uid)

        used to get the company details for an user for ascessing the operation use api/company/getcompany path for adding company details use the path company/putcompany

        Returns:
        the result json object with the company details

      • putcompanyfromauth

        @POST
 @Path(value="putcompany")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response putcompanyfromauth(@HeaderParam(value="uid")
                                                                                                                                                                                                           java.lang.String uid,
                                                                                                                                                                                                           com.example.PurSalAutoServer.Entities.Company c)

        used to add the company details for an user for ascessing the operation use api/company/putcompany path can be used to add only for first time for editing an existing details use the path company/editcompany

        Parameters:
        compnany - object for which add
        Returns:
        the result json object with result code and result description

      • editcompanyfromauth

        @PUT
 @Path(value="editcompany")
 @Consumes(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response editcompanyfromauth(@HeaderParam(value="uid")
                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String uid,
                                                                                                                                                                                                            com.example.PurSalAutoServer.Entities.Company c)

        used to edit the existing company details

        The operation asscessed using the api/company/editcompany path

        Parameters:
        Company - object you want to edit name cannot be edited
        Returns:
        the result json object with result code and result description
